title: job.reschedule results in a ERR value is not a double
body:
I use the less known method `reschedule` sometimes, however I also seem to stumble upon the same exception every now and then: 

> Redis::CommandError: ERR value is not a double

With the following backtrace:

> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-3.0.4/lib/redis/client.rb:85:in `call'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-3.0.4/lib/redis.rb:1353:in`block in zadd'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-3.0.4/lib/redis.rb:36:in `block in synchronize'
> /usr/local/rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p448/lib/ruby/1.9.1/monitor.rb:211:in`mon_synchronize'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-3.0.4/lib/redis.rb:36:in `synchronize'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-3.0.4/lib/redis.rb:1347:in`zadd'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/sidekiq-2.14.1/lib/sidekiq/api.rb:263:in `block in schedule'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/connection_pool-1.1.0/lib/connection_pool.rb:49:in`with'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/sidekiq-2.14.1/lib/sidekiq.rb:67:in `redis'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/sidekiq-2.14.1/lib/sidekiq/api.rb:262:in`schedule'
> [GEM_ROOT]/gems/sidekiq-2.14.1/lib/sidekiq/api.rb:222:in `reschedule'

I've started debugging this issue and noticed that `redis.zadd` expects a score as float, while sidekiq casts a timestamp to a string in the schedule method:

``` ruby
def schedule(timestamp, message)
  Sidekiq.redis do |conn|
    conn.zadd(@zset, timestamp.to_s, Sidekiq.dump_json(message))
  end
end
```

From the redis inline docs: 

``` ruby
# @example Add a single `[score, member]` pair to a sorted set
#   `redis.zadd("zset", 32.0, "member")`
```

PS: this never seems to occur when scheduling a job for the first time using `Worker.perform_at(timestamp,args)`.

Is there anything I can do to help, or am I simply doing it wrong?
